00024 namespace boost {

00026 namespace detail {
00027 
00028 inline const char *letters() {
00029     return "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ";
00030 }
00031 
00032 inline char nToChar(int n, bool upperCase) {
00033     if (n < 10) return char(n + '0');
00034     else return letters()[n - 10 + (upperCase ? 26 : 0)];
00035 }
00036 
00037 template <typename CharT>
00038 int nFromChar(CharT c) {
00039     // Digits are easy, they're guaranteed contiguous.
00040     if (c >= '0' && c <= '9') return c - '0';
00041 
00042     // Letters might not be.
00043     if (c <= (std::numeric_limits<char>::max)()) {
00044         const char *ll = letters(), *p = strchr(ll, char(c));
00045         if (p != 0) return ((p - ll) % 26) + 10;
00046     }
00047 
00048     return -1;
00049 }
00050 
00051 template <typename CharT>
00052 bool is_hex_digit(CharT c) {
00053     int n = nFromChar(c);
00054     return (n >= 0 && n <= 0x0f);
00055 }
00056 
00057 template <typename charT, bitsize_t Bits, bool Secure, class Alloc>
00058 std::basic_string<charT> to_string(const BOOST_XINT_RAWINT &n, std::size_t base
00059     = 10, bool uppercase = false)
00060 {
00061     if (base < 2 || base > 36) exception_handler<>::call(__FILE__, __LINE__,
00062         exceptions::invalid_base());
00063 
00064     std::basic_ostringstream<charT> out;
00065     if (n.is_zero()) {
00066         out << "0";
00067         return out.str();
00068     }
00069 
00070     if (base == 2 || base == 4 || base == 16) {
00071         // Fast no-division version, useful for debugging division and for cases
00072         // where maximum speed is necessary.
00073         const digit_t *firstDigit = n.digits(), *lastDigit = firstDigit +
00074             n.length - 1;
00075 
00076         if (n.negative) out << '-';
00077 
00078         int bits_per_base_b_digit = 0;
00079         while (base > 1) { base = base >> 1; ++bits_per_base_b_digit; }
00080         const digit_t mask = (doubledigit_t(1) << bits_per_base_b_digit) - 1;
00081 
00082         // Skip any leading zeros
00083         const digit_t *d = lastDigit;
00084         int digitShift = (bits_per_digit - bits_per_base_b_digit);
00085         while (digitShift >= 0 && ((*d >> digitShift) & mask) == 0)
00086             digitShift -= bits_per_base_b_digit;
00087 
00088         do {
00089             while (digitShift >= 0) {
00090                 out << nToChar((*d >> digitShift) & mask, uppercase);
00091                 digitShift -= bits_per_base_b_digit;
00092             }
00093 
00094             digitShift = (bits_per_digit - bits_per_base_b_digit);
00095         } while (d-- != firstDigit);
00096 
00097         return out.str();
00098     } else {
00099         // ATTN: for when there's nothing more pressing to do
00100         // This could be made a lot more efficient for very large numbers, by
00101         // dividing n by base raised to whatever number of digits will fit into
00102         // a doubledigit_t, then just doing single-digit divides for that many
00103         // digits before going back to n for another chunk. That would be
00104         // premature optimization though, so I'm just making this note instead.
00105         // If someone can show me a use-case where more efficiency is needed in
00106         // this function, I'll add it later.
00107 
00108         BOOST_XINT_RAWINT shift;
00109         shift.set_unsigned(base);
00110         typename BOOST_XINT_RAWINT::divide_t a(divide(n.abs(), shift));
00111         do {
00112             out << nToChar(a.remainder[0], uppercase);
00113             a = divide(a.quotient, shift);
00114         } while (!a.quotient.is_zero());
00115         if (!a.remainder.is_zero()) out << nToChar(a.remainder[0], uppercase);
00116 
00117         if (n.negative) out << '-';
00118 
00119         std::basic_string<charT> rval = out.str();
00120         std::reverse(rval.begin(), rval.end());
00121         return rval;
00122     }
00123 }
00124 
00125 BOOST_XINT_RAWINT_TPL
00126 template <typename charT>
00127 void BOOST_XINT_RAWINT::from_string(const charT *str, const charT*& endptr,
00128     std::size_t base)
00129 {
00130     bool negate = false;
00131     const charT *c = str;
00132     while (isspace(*c)) ++c;
00133 
00134     if (*c == '+') ++c;
00135     else if (*c == '-') { negate = true; ++c; }
00136 
00137     if (base == autobase) {
00138         if (*c == '0') {
00139             ++c;
00140             if (*c == 'x' || *c == 'X') {
00141                 ++c;
00142                 base = 16;
00143             } else base = 8;
00144         } else base = 10;
00145     }
00146 
00147     if (base < 2 || base > 36) exception_handler<>::call(__FILE__, __LINE__,
00148         exceptions::invalid_base());
00149     if (*c == 0) exception_handler<>::call(__FILE__, __LINE__,
00150         exceptions::invalid_digit("No valid digits"));
00151 
00152     std::basic_string<charT> tstr;
00153     if (negate) tstr.push_back('-');
00154     if (base <= 10) {
00155         const charT p = charT('0' + base);
00156         while (*c >= '0' && *c < p)
00157             tstr.push_back(*c++);
00158     } else while (nFromChar(*c) >= 0) tstr.push_back(*c++);
00159     endptr = c;
00160 
00161     from_string(tstr, base);
00162 }
00163 
00164 BOOST_XINT_RAWINT_TPL
00165 template <typename charT>
00166 void BOOST_XINT_RAWINT::from_string(const charT *str, std::size_t base) {
00167     bool negate = false;
00168     const charT *c = str;
00169     if (*c == '+') ++c;
00170     else if (*c == '-') { negate = true; ++c; }
00171 
00172     if (base == autobase) {
00173         if (*c == '0') {
00174             ++c;
00175             if (*c == 'x' || *c == 'X') {
00176                 ++c;
00177                 base = 16;
00178             } else base = 8;
00179         } else base = 10;
00180     }
00181 
00182     if (base < 2 || base > 36) exception_handler<>::call(__FILE__, __LINE__,
00183         exceptions::invalid_base());
00184     if (*c == 0) exception_handler<>::call(__FILE__, __LINE__,
00185         exceptions::invalid_digit("No valid digits"));
00186 
00187     // ATTN: for when there's nothing more pressing to do
00188     // This function could use the same efficiency improvements that to_string
00189     // uses, but there's even less need for them here. Show me a use-case where
00190     // they're needed and I'll add them; until then, this will suffice.
00191 
00192     BOOST_XINT_RAWINT shift, digit;
00193     shift.set_unsigned(base);
00194 
00195     set(0);
00196     while (*c) {
00197         int val = nFromChar(*c);
00198         if (val < 0) exception_handler<>::call(__FILE__, __LINE__,
00199             exceptions::invalid_digit("encountered non-alphanumeric character "
00200             "in string"));
00201         digit.set(val);
00202 
00203         if (digit >= shift) exception_handler<>::call(__FILE__, __LINE__,
00204             exceptions::invalid_digit("encountered digit greater than base "
00205             "allows"));
00206 
00207         *this *= shift;
00208         *this += digit;
00209         ++c;
00210     }
00211 
00212     negative = negate;
00213     trim();
00214 }
00215 
00216 BOOST_XINT_RAWINT_TPL
00217 template <typename charT, typename traitsT, typename allocT>
00218 void BOOST_XINT_RAWINT::from_string(const std::basic_string<charT, traitsT,
00219     allocT>& str, std::size_t base)
00220 {
00221     from_string(str.c_str(), base);
00222 }

00224 BOOST_XINT_RAWINT_TPL
00225 xint::binary_t to_binary(const BOOST_XINT_RAWINT &n, std::size_t bits = 0) {
00226     if (bits > std::size_t(std::numeric_limits<unsigned char>::digits))
00227         exception_handler<>::call(__FILE__, __LINE__,
00228         exceptions::invalid_argument("can't fit that many bits into an "
00229         "unsigned character on this system"));
00230     if (bits == 0) bits = std::numeric_limits<unsigned char>::digits;
00231 
00232     bitqueue_t bitqueue;
00233     const digit_t *s = n.digits(), *se = s + n.length;
00234     while (s != se) bitqueue.push(*s++, bits_per_digit);
00235 
00236     xint::binary_t target;
00237     while (!bitqueue.empty()) target.push_back(static_cast<unsigned char>
00238       (bitqueue.pop(bits)));
00239     while (!target.empty() && target.back()==0) target.pop_back();
00240     return target;
00241 }
00242 
00243 BOOST_XINT_RAWINT_TPL
00244 void BOOST_XINT_RAWINT::from_binary(const xint::binary_t &b, std::size_t bits) {
00245     if (bits > std::size_t(std::numeric_limits<unsigned char>::digits))
00246         exception_handler<>::call(__FILE__, __LINE__,
00247         exceptions::invalid_argument("can't fit that many bits into an "
00248         "unsigned character on this system"));
00249     if (bits == 0) bits = std::numeric_limits<unsigned char>::digits;
00250 
00251     bitqueue_t bitqueue;
00252     for (xint::binary_t::const_iterator s = b.begin(), se = b.end(); s != se;
00253         ++s) bitqueue.push(*s, bits);
00254 
00255     digit_t *d = digits(bits_to_digits(b.size() * bits), realloc::ignore), *t =
00256         d, *te = t + max_length();
00257     while (t != te && !bitqueue.empty())
00258       *t++ = static_cast<digit_t>(bitqueue.pop(bits_per_digit));
00259     length = (t - d);
00260     trim();
00261 }
00262 
00263 template <typename T, bitsize_t Bits, bool Secure, class Alloc>
00264 T to(const BOOST_XINT_RAWINT &n, typename boost::enable_if<boost::is_integral<T>
00265     >::type* = 0)
00266 {
00267     using std::numeric_limits;
00268 
00269     static const BOOST_XINT_RAWINT tmin((numeric_limits<T>::min)());
00270     static const BOOST_XINT_RAWINT tmax((numeric_limits<T>::max)());
00271     if (n < tmin || n > tmax) exception_handler<>::call(__FILE__, __LINE__,
00272         exceptions::too_big("value out of range for requested conversion"));
00273 
00274     // Workaround for MSVC8's C4309 warning, "truncation of constant value"
00275     doubledigit_t shift_tmp = digit_overflowbit;
00276     T rval = 0, shift = T(shift_tmp);
00277     for (std::size_t x = 0; x < n.length; ++x) {
00278         if (sizeof(T) > sizeof(digit_t)) rval *= shift;
00279         rval += static_cast<T>(n[n.length - x - 1]);
00280     }
00281     if (n.negative) rval *= static_cast<T>(-1);
00282     return rval;
00283 }
